page.title: 05WARE PARK WOODLAND, WARE.
page.content: Ware Park has many old trees, mainly oaks,limes and beeches which had been neglected until recently. Many elms, wiped out by{Dutch Elm disease,}have been felled and new trees planted.Part of an avenue of limes still exists. It used to stretch from Bengeo Street to Glaxos in Ware. The remaining shallow- rooted limes have grown too tall and, sadly, five have fallen in high winds. Only drastic surgery can save others. Recently,{a tree surgeon}was allowed to set up his 5 acre base and build a home on the edge of the woods. To mark his son's 1st birthday, he planted an {arboretum}of 1-yr-old trees.To replace elms, he has planted{Southern Beeches which have grown 2\m in 5 years but he thinks they may outgrow their roots. {Animals}in the woods include foxes, grey squirrels, pheasants, partridges, rabbits, badgers and muntjack deer.
